intro: Adhatoda letestui, commonly known as the African elaeocarpus, is a tropical plant native to regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces small, black berries that are often used in traditional medicine. Its botanical features include a woody stem, opposite leaf arrangement, and a distinctive floral structure. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
